result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody R Birk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody R Birk appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Cody R Birk.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cody R Birk in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes. Thomas Hasle appeared in Court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled to readdress the Request for Substitution on defense counsel's request.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Conen.  
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Richards, Br. 30. 
Court vacates the 9/16/2022 plea/sentencing hearing.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.

Defendant Cody R Birk in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes. Thomas Hasle appeared in Court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed but not acted upon. Judge Conen (Branch 13) spun plea/sentencing hearing to Judge Davila (Branch 1) which accepted.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cody R Birk in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense requested more time to allow defendant to receive more treatment granted by the court.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cody R Birk in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody R Birk appeared by video means with Attorney.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, received and filed.

Defendant Cody R Birk in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Fuentes has not gone over offer with client at this time and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Matthew D C, 04/02/1969.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cody R Birk in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Cody R Birk in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody R Birk appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
